intro: Terminalia balladellii, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. Terminalia balladellii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along waterways.
